meanings.definition: To provide new or updated information to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reinforms the students about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: The news article reinforms readers about the latest developments.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot reinforms its owner with a funny joke.
meanings.sent4: The changing weather reinforms us to always be prepared.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock reinforms us that it's time to wake up.

meanings.definition: To give fresh knowledge or understanding to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The documentary reinforms viewers about the history of space exploration.
meanings.sent2: Reading books reinforms our minds and broadens our perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy reinforms its owner by fetching the newspaper.
meanings.sent4: Traveling to new places reinforms us of the beauty of the world.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's advice reinforms us to always strive for improvement.
